alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 9:12AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Floyd and Chattooga Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 912 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Yellow Creek Falls, or near Little River Canyon National Preserve, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Summerville, Trion, Cave Spring, Lyerly, Menlo, Lindale, Subligna, Tidings, Armuchee, Coosa, Cloudland, Berryton, Chattoogaville, James H. Floyd State Park, and Holland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
